Yeah, I know...

9 minutes ago, CobaltWolf said:

Re: Venera, Beale made a Venera 11/13 lander but there is a lot more to those probes. The Venera 1 solar panels and dish are somewhat unique, as are the course correction engines of the later models, among other things. Perhaps a minimod addon for Kerbaloons?

Hm. I could've sworn I saw the Venera panels and lander in Tantares... That is a great site, by the way! I want to add more Russian parts to the game and expose people to some cool stuff they did. I may find a way to merge some of those into my designs. I should also be fine with poly-counts. The HTV probe core is pushing 600 tris, I think 1500 for the engine assembly. The RTG is 368.

15 minutes ago, CobaltWolf said:

What do you even bring up with the KIS storage? I've never found something I've felt a need to bring up in a CTV type vessel.

I keep spare parts and I assemble parts of the station in-orbit with KAS, because it's fun. My main concern at the time was having a way to replenish my LS supplies (I use USI-LS) that was somewhat realistic. Rocketparts, fertilizer, ore and all the other USI supplies could also be cargo.

19 minutes ago, CobaltWolf said:

Yes, you use the Maya object transforms. I usually do it with nulls. Name them all the same and the game figures everything out automatically.

Thank you, thank you! I'd give you rep if I knew how

It's the huge number of editor parts, and mods to keep up with, that makes me turn some of them down. I used to have KW, Tantares, T-LV, and an early Contares I think in 1.04. In 1.05, I sacrificed all of those to try BDB, Planetary Base Systems, SXT, and RLA Stockalike. I even removed all the KSOS shuttle parts to clear some room, and will use the Mk3 parts instead.

Update

Due to work and family, it is looking like Sunday is the only guaranteed day that I can get anything done. As planned, I continued doing nothing but models with no texture work. Although I did UV a few things wherever I could re-use a pre-made texture. Some of this is temporary to get an idea of how things will look. This week I switched gears little (again) from H-II. I wanted to get another probe core part finished so I pushed to complete the Pioneer-inspired HECS core, which is 0.9375m in diameter. During my research I found a couple of cool little things, for example, a probe core body is referred to as a "Bus." Also, NASA research costs prompted designs to be reused. Cassini used bus designs from Voyager and Galileo, which in turn used the designs of Mariner. Voyager was actually supposed to be a higher budget Mariner program, but was renamed. Viking also used bus designs derived from Mariner!

I also worked on my first antenna, designed to go with this bus. The design draws more from Cassini than Pioneer because as planned, I will have a small, a med, and a large static antenna so I had to pick 3 designs to use. I didn't want to use too much inspiration from just one mission, and I think it fits fairly well. This will be the medium-sized one:

Edited February 29, 2016 by akron
Will your antennae be functional and compatible with remote tech?

4 hours ago, Cornholio said:

Will your antennae be functional and compatible with remote tech? 

I am not sure what you mean by functional, I mean, they work. I did not have plans for support for Antenna range or Remote Tech. I was hoping KSP 1.1 would have been out with its antenna overhaul, but it looks like that has been pushed back. With that in mind, I will probably reach out to other community members for help with RT configs, since I do not know how to create those.

I am also hoping for some additional thoughts or feedback on the planned parts and mod progress so far. Let me know your thoughts on the current roadmap.

Also, just my opinion, I like your versions of these science experiments, but would more than anything prefer to see new experiment in addition to/instead.  I only speak for myself and may not reflect your goal for this part pack.

Good luck!

Well, as mentioned, due to the delay of the stock communication overhaul, I will try to include RT support. I may just need to peak in the RT files to learn how to do them or get help. I do not use RT on my install so I am not personally very familiar with it.

Thanks for your feedback on the experiments! I do have some new experiments planed, a windspeed/Weather station for landers based on Mars missions, a soil drill/sampler based on Curiosity or Viking, more than likely, and a dust experiment based on NASA's Stardust mission and others. For the most part, though, @DMagic has the science experiments covered and very well done. If I can come up with some new, different experiments, I will definitely add them in. I am super open to suggestions!

Edited March 3, 2016 by akron

DMagic's science parts caused me to go on an endless hunt for more and more science parts.  I have many from the common like DMagic's to obscure like Kerbal Dust Experiment.  Hope/can't wait to see more from you. Again, everything you have showcased looks beautiful.

Edited March 4, 2016 by CobaltWolf

Update - Science!

Thanks @CobaltWolf for all the suggestions.

Blue update, no new models. I will try to work on some later today. I have spent more time than I care to admit revising the science road map for the mod and researching A LOT of science instruments and missions (and looking for reference images). It is still subject to change, but it feels more "focused" now because I have reference and know what each one will roughly look like. Note that this is a road map primarily for the probe expansion, more science may get added with the lander pack. At this point it is looking more and more like DMagic will be a required pre-requisite for Probes Plus and the subsequent Lander pack. Several instruments will have double functions and are will be spread out around the tech tree.

Here is the new science plan, I will update the OP later. Multi-mod experiment legend: New, Stock, BDB experiment, DMagic experiment, SCANSat instrument

New Experiment Parts:

  • Windspeed/Weather station + Thermometer + Barometer (Mars Landers)
  • Dust Experiment (Stardust) (May try to incorporate KDEX support instead)
  • Dust Experiment + Meteorite Counter (New Horizons)
  • Gamma-Ray Spectrometer (Mars Recon Orbiter)
  • Ultraviolet Spectrograph/Atmospheric Analyzer (Rosetta/New Horizons,MAVEN)
  • Solar Wind Analyzer (MAVEN, New Horizons)
  • Ionization and Electrostatic Analyzer (Ranger 1,IBEX)
  • Radar Scatterometer and Radiometer + GORESat (MetOp,DSCOVR)

Redesigns for all basic stock experiments 

  • Thermometer DONE
  • Barometer DONE
  • Gravioli DONE
  • Seismic
  • Atmos
  • Goo

DMagic Experiments:

  • Magnetometer (Pioneer 10) DONE
  • Magnetometer (Voyager,Cassini,Galileo)
  • Orbital Telescope (Mars Recon Orbiter)
  • Compact Orbital Telescope + BDB High-tech camera (possibly) (New Horizons)
  • RPWS (Cassini)
  • Soil Moisture Sensor + Antenna + Low-Res Altimeter (SMAP)
  • Solar Particle Collector + Dust Collector (Genesis,Beagle solar panel design)
  • Multispectral Sensor + BDB IR (Voyager)
  • Soil sampler drill (Mars Rovers; will be part of the Lander Pack)

SCANSat Parts:

  • Low-Res RADAR Altimeter (TOPEX)
  • High-Res Laser Altimeter (Mars Global Surveyor)
  • Biome Scanner + BDB IR (Mars Missions)

EDIT: The multiple experiments are to try and replicate some real-world missions and add more things to do without having to add more parts. I will do so at every reasonable opportunity

Edited March 6, 2016 by akron
